results.title: 2 White House Officials Helped Give Nunes Intelligence Reports
results.abstract: The revelation fueled criticism that Representative Devin Nunes has been too eager to do the White House’s bidding, not run an independent investigation

results.title: Ivanka Trump, Shifting Plans, Will Become a Federal Employee
results.abstract: The president’s elder daughter had drawn criticism from ethics experts after saying she would serve as an informal adviser to her father.

media.caption: Ivanka Trump during a meeting with female small-business owners at the White House on Monday.

results.byline: By ERIC LIPTON and JESSE DRUCKER
results.title: Trump Couple, Now White House Employees, Can’t Escape Conflict Laws
results.abstract: Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump are walking on perilous legal and ethical ground, according to several prominent experts on the subject.

media.caption: Jared Kushner and his wife, Ivanka Trump, leave the Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Fla. The couple’s real estate and investment empire is estimated to be worth as much as $740 million.

results.adx_keywords: Flynn, Michael T;Russia;Presidential Election of 2016;Immunity from Prosecution;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J
results.byline: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
results.title: Michael Flynn Offers to Testify Before Congress in Exchange for Immunity
results.abstract: An official said investigators were unwilling to broker a deal with Mr. Flynn, the former national security adviser, until their Russia inquiry was further along.

media.caption: An immunity deal would make it impossible for the Justice Department to prosecute Michael T. Flynn.
media.copyright: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Agriculture and Farming;Pesticides;Environment;Environmental Protection Agency;Pruitt, Scott;Trump, Donald J;Dow Chemical Company;Chlorpyrifos (Insecticide)
results.byline: By ERIC LIPTON
results.title: E.P.A. Chief, Rejecting Agency’s Science, Chooses Not to Ban Insecticide
results.abstract: E.P.A. scientists had concluded that exposure to the chemical, chlorpyrifos, which has been in use since 1965, was potentially causing significant health consequences.

media.caption: Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, on Tuesday. Mr. Pruitt rejected a petition filed a decade ago by two environmental groups asking that the agency ban all uses of chlorpyrifos.

results.title: Repeal of Affordable Care Act Is Back on Agenda, Republicans Say
results.abstract: Under pressure from conservative activists, House Republican leaders and the White House say they have restarted negotiations.

media.caption: Stephen K. Bannon, one of President Trump’s chief advisers, left a meeting at the Capitol last week during negotiations on the American Health Care Act.

results.title: ‘We Must Fight Them’: Trump Goes After Conservatives of Freedom Caucus
results.abstract: The president came out swinging against the group’s members on Twitter, suggesting Republicans should “fight them” in the 2018 midterms if they do not back his agenda.

results.title: In Ohio County That Backed Trump, Word of Housing Cuts Stirs Fear
results.abstract: Some people in Trumbull County say they will suffer if home-repair, rental-assistance and other programs are eliminated as President Trump has sought.

media.caption: Joseph and Tammy Pavlic outside their home in Kinsman, Ohio. To repair the house, they tapped a program that President Trump is seeking to eliminate.

results.abstract: The man was taken into custody on suspicion of second-degree murder on Saturday, the police said.

results.title: Sweeping Federal Review Could Affect Consent Decrees Nationwide

results.title: White House Addresses Trump’s Unorthodox Call to Preet Bharara
results.abstract: Despite being asked repeatedly on Saturday about the nature of the call, the White House was silent until Sunday, when it said the president was trying to extend his good wishes to Mr. Bharara.

results.byline: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
results.title: Sean Spicer Repeats Trump’s Unproven Wiretapping Allegation
results.abstract: Senior government officials have repeatedly and forcefully rejected the claim, saying they have seen no evidence of direct surveillance by the Obama administration.

media.caption: Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, during a briefing on Friday. Mr. Spicer insisted that President Trump had been surveilled by the Obama administration, even though senior government officials say there is no evidence for the claim.
